post_text: Please remember... If any parent or guardian wants to change their educational intentions from the previous survey, please notify your child‚Äôs building principal by Friday, July 31 so we can start grouping students to meet the distancing guidelines for the Hybrid Education Plan as well as prepare for online instruction.

If any parent or guardian wants to change their educational intentions from the previous survey, please notify your child‚Äôs building principal by Friday, July 31 so we can start grouping students to meet the distancing guidelines for the Hybrid Education Plan as well as prepare for online instruction.

post_text: So many families chose face-to-face instruction, in order to comply with PA Health guidelines, the hybrid model (found in the PowerPoint sent out earlier) for education has been implemented. Families may still choose to do the hybrid model or an online model with the district. As guidelines change, we can be flexible in going forward.

post_text: Attention Senior Parents: Please make sure your senior is at the stadium by 9 am for graduation practice. A luncheon and the traditional sundae bar will follow. Students are to report back to the field house at 6 pm for graduation at 7 pm.

post_text: After speaking with the events coordinator at The George Washington Hotel, it has been brought to our attention that the hotel has many guidelines to follow for large events such as prom. However, the state guidelines for holding such events prohibits dancing. With that being said, it is with regret, that we cancel the 2020 Chartiers-Houston Prom.
text: After speaking with the events coordinator at The George Washington Hotel, it has been brought to our attention that the hotel has many guidelines to follow for large events such as prom. However, the state guidelines for holding such events prohibits dancing. With that being said, it is with regret, that we cancel the 2020 Chartiers-Houston Prom.

post_text:
Tomorrow we begin our online learning. Between 12:01 am and 11:59 am students should go on the district website and submit their attendance on the online form. If students do not have technology, they should call their building secretaries to report attendance.

Please check the announcement section of the website for login information to access students 365 accounts - which has their school emails and TEAMS where online classes will take place.

Teachers will actively be monitoring there TEAMS from 10-12 and 12:30-2:30 with office hours from 2:30-3:30. Students can contact their teachers during these time or at other times through other classroom communication (email, Remind 101, Class Dojo etc. ).

This is uncharted territory for all - please be patient. We are in this together and together we will get through this.
text:
Tomorrow we begin our online learning. Between 12:01 am and 11:59 am students should go on the district website and submit their attendance on the online form. If students do not have technology, they should call their building secretaries to report attendance.

Teachers will actively be monitoring there TEAMS from 10-12 and 12:30-2:30 with office hours from 2:30-3:30. Students can contact their teachers during these time or at other times through other classroom communication (email, Remind 101, Class Dojo etc. ).

This is uncharted territory for all - please be patient. We are in this together and together we will get through this.

PA State Rep. Tim O'Neal
February 24 at 2:45 PM ¬∑

shared_text:
Chartiers Township
January 6 at 3:32 PM ¬∑

Please Note Recycling in Chartiers Township remains the 2nd Monday of each month.

Please find below the 2020 Chartiers Township Recycling Calendar. We are awaiting corrected recycling calendars from Waste Management as the first proof they sent did not list glass as a recyclable item and glass remains RECYCLABLE in Chartiers Township. In the meantime this is just the calendar for reference.

Please remember that all recyclables must be in a receptacle clearly marked "RECYCLABLES." NO bags.
